reviewText: I should've read the reviews on this before I spent the money. Not worth $10. It is a playable game, but last I checked, there is no multiplayer, and its very simply done. The core game logic is there, but the animations are simple and cheesy, and they don't fit the theme of a tabletop game.\n\n

reviewText: A nifty little game, with some enjoyable new game types that make things a bit more entertaining. The salvo and Superweapons game modes add a bit more dimension instead of simply B1, miss, C3, miss, D6, hit..... ect...\n\nNothing special, but easily worth it if you find it on sale or liked this game growing up,

reviewText: it is a fun game. challenging to a point you have to achieve things to get better weapons in super weapons mode. the draw back is the pc  plaer is not bound by the task it will get the weapons no matter what! the game i enjoy but the higher you go the pc becomes better i have never got all weapons. 1 you need to hit all 5 ships in 1 attack. the other you need to sink all 5 without a loss of your ship and the big 1 a satelite laser you have to kill all 5 enemy ships in 10 attacks. if you add it up    the total is 17 but if the pc is given the bonus cruiser now its 20. it is not possible when the pc gets all the weapons without doing what the player has to do to get the same weapons. this  game was set up never to be beat! I still try thinking maybe i will get lucky and catch a break and get the weapons to win the super weapons level as far as the rest of the salvoe mode and classic excellent! a fun game.

reviewText: If you're looking for a simple, but still cool, single-player Battleship game, then Pop Cap made the perfect one right here. Not only does it show the use of white and red pegs to give an authentic feel to it, but also some animated radar cosmetics. You're shown some eye candy animated cutscenes with every shot for either a miss or a hit, and the background graphics comes complete with random weather and ambient sound effects. You can easily immerse yourself into the game and play for hours while trying to increase your rank. It's a very pleasant chillaxing" type of game where everything is point-n-click super easy.\n\nI like all 3 modes of Classic
hoursPlayed:
but Super Weapon is my favorite mode. Super Weapon is probably everybody's favorite.

In Classic mode it's your basic Battleship game where you and the computer take turns destroying each other. Not that much to it.

In Salvo mode it's a Ship-turn-Shot game. If you have 5 ships
voteText: then you get 5 shots on your turn. Lose a ship and you lose a shot for only 4 shots per turn. Then 3
votesTotal: if you're having a bad game. Trying to maintain 5 shots is really hard to do
votesFunny: but not impossible. Salvo is Salvo
commentsCount: that's all there is to it.\n\nIn Super Weapon mode it's a Weapons-charge-Shot game. You only get 1 shot per turn
column16: but you can really make that shot count when your weapons charge up. With one shot you can fire upon 1
column22: depending on what weapon you have loaded into your arsenal. There's bombers
column28: and a bunch of others I haven't even unlocked yet. Yes
column29: you have to unlock most of the weapons by continuing to play the game and keep sinking enemy ships over and over
column30: round after round. You also have to rank up to unlock some of the weapons too.\n\nThe graphics are not superb
column31: but it's good enough for this type of game.\n\nThe sounds would be what you normally expect with clicks
column34: and other sounds matching their device or purpose. Some of the ambient sounds can get a little annoying and repetitive
column35: but still tolerable.\n\nNow let's talk about the A.I. - It starts out rather easy and appears to be dumb at first
column36: but after you play the game and start ranking up
column37: the A.I. appears to match your rank and gains intelligence. It also uses a multiple random seed to pick coordinates and this is reflected with the multiple decisions you see the A.I. making before taking a shot. Seeking your ships is completely random
column38: but after it gets a hit the A.I. will concentrate on sinking that ship with similar human intelligence. You will notice the A.I. behavior by the time you reach Captain and your usual ship configurations that used to trick the A.I. does not work anymore. That's how I know this Battleship game has an advanced A.I.
column39: and is a worthy opponent.\n\nI would recommend this game to anyone who likes board games."

reviewText: This is a somewhat enjoyable game, I rate 3 out of 5.  My primary objection is a lack of a multiplayer setting either through hotseat or over the web.  If yuou want to play against a reasonably random AI in a single player mode of an old classic, then go for it.

reviewText: I bought this game on sale today (3-22-2014) for $3.99.  The game is worth it for that price.  I liked the graphics and salvo mode and superweapon mode.  It is sufficiently replayable for $3.99, as you can work up the ranks up to Admiral.  The game would be better if it had online multiplayer.  I would not pay the full price of $9.99 for this game, however.

reviewText: A nice little Battleship game, I rather liked the superweapons game mode.  I drawback I can say is that fact it is singleplayer only since battleship has always been a two player game, this is unfortunate but, I suppose if you don't have a person to play battleship with this works almost as well.  All around not bad but not particularly spectacular either.

reviewText:
So I got all four board games made by this developer, decided to playtest each of them.

I quite like Batllship, fun little board game.

I'll keep this specific review short since I'm not too sure what to say about it.

It's battleship with some verry annoying (and togglable) cutscenes.  Just turn off all sounds and cutscenes, turn on your music of choice, and enjoy the classic board game.
